text: [Music]
hello I'm Calvin a cloud support
engineer here at the adws office in
Sydney today I'm going to show you how
to use the adws command line interface
to get temporary credentials for an AWS
identity and access management identity
center user let's get
started in the AWS command line
interface navigate to the tia. AWS SS so
Cas
directory then run the ls command to
view the files in the current
directory note that there are two Json
files run the cat or type command
followed by the file name to view each
of the Json files
contents note cat command is for Linux
type command is the equivalent for
Windows CMD or
Parell we can see that one file contains
an access token and one does not note
the access token value in the Json
file now we can run the AWS CLI command
get roll credentials to get the
credentials of an I am identity center
user here we must provide an account ID
and a rle name that refers to a name of
a permission
set finally provide the region where the
I am identity Center is configured and
and the access token that you noted
earlier the output of temporary
credentials is now on the screen and now
you know how to use the AWS CLI to get
temporary credentials for an IM am
identity center
user thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
